name: Thermobaric Cloud Deployment Rail
on_attack: Cover the blast area in Soft Cover cloud until the end of the next round, slowing any characters within it. If any mech currently affected by Burn enters the cloud or starts their turn in it, the cloud explodes, clearing the target’s Burn, ending the area effect, and deals 1d6+3 AP Explosive Damage to all characters within the cloud. Characters can only be damaged by one cloud per explosion. Multiple overlapping clouds are counted as one cloud for the purpose of detonation.

tags.name: ORDNANCE
tags.description: This weapon can only be fired before the user moves or takes any other actions on their turn, excepting Protocols. The user can still act and move normally after attacking. Additionally, because of its size, this weapon can’t be used against targets in engagement with the user’s mech, and cannot be used for Overwatch.

name: Flare Gun
description: Normally a tool for signaling allies and revealing enemies, the SSC All-Weather Flare Gun contains specialized flares that can stick to any surfaces, burn in any weather condition and produce intense light and heat in small packages. This also makes it a viable weapon in a pinch, as the flare proves difficult to get rid of once it has attached itself to an enemy mech and started burning.

name: Caestus
description: IPS-N's Caestus is designed as a quick and easy to access melee weapon for close quarter mechs, being able to fit comfortably on top of a mech’s brachial structure without interfering with weapon manipulation, amplifying a mech’s already prodigious strength with even more blunt force trauma.
effect: Gain the And Stay Down reaction.

actions.name: And Stay Down
actions.detail: Attack with this weapon against that character. On a hit, the character must succeed on a contested Hull Check or be knocked prone, again. This does not count against the reaction limit.
actions.trigger: An adjacent enemy attempts to stand up from Prone.

name: Arc Suppressor
description: Adapted from non-lethal stun gun designs, the Arc Suppressor discards all pretenses of safety and peacekeeping purposes to discharge extremely high voltage bursts of destructive electricity from rows of heavy duty capacitors. Though slow to charge, it can fry the system of an entire squad of mechs in one burst, making it a potent tool for crowd control.
on_crit: The target must succeed on a System Save or be Stunned until the start of their next turn.

name: Dharmachakra
description: A strange weapon, shaped like that of a wheel. Beneath its simple construction lies a powerful kinetic battery system capable of storing the energy of each turn of the wheel, allowing mechs to power up this weapon in the field with no external power source needed. At a moment’s notice, all the stored energy may be released, causing devastating damage.

name: Blackjack Cabled Dagger
description: When enemy signal defense proves unassailable, sometimes, a more direct and physical approach to electronic warfare is needed. A magnetic blade attached to a high bandwidth reinforced cable, the Blackjack attaches itself to whatever its blade hits and establishes a direct connection between its user and the enemy mech, allowing them to upload code attacks directly into the enemy’s system.
effect: 1/round, when you make a tech attack against the Tethered target, treat it as having its E-def halved. The Tether can be broken by succeeding on an Engineering Check as a quick action, you releasing it as a free action, you loading the weapon, or the Painted Lady becoming further than threat from the target.
on_hit: The target is Tethered and records its distance to you. When Tethered, it cannot move such that its distance to you exceeds the recorded distance.

name: TH2 Tomahawk
description: Delicately balanced through precise design and manufacturing, the TH2 Tomahawk is an upgrade to the standard issue TH1 Tomahawk, boasting lighter weight, a more ergonomic design, a re-designed shape to facilitate the throwing of the weapon, and an integrated magtech retriever in the handle for quick retrieval under ideal circumstances.
effect: When you retrieve this weapon after it has been thrown, make an Agility Check. On a success, you may immediately throw this weapon again as a free action at +1 Difficulty. This check can only trigger 1/round off of each retrieval method.

name: Flechette Shotgun
description: “This morning the city police department confiscated five firearms during a raid on an Ungrateful cell within District 5. Among the obtained contrabands were two assault shotguns, modified from the common pattern approved for hunting. Look at these shells: Hundreds of tiny fin stabilized needles. Ladies and Gentleman, this is a weapon designed for assassination, solely to kill people, if you need any further proof of the barbarity of these extremist movements”
effect: Against targets with 0 armor or Shredded, this gains +3 damage.

name: Karpov Shortwave Area-Denial System
description: Commonly referred to as “The Microwave”, the Karpov was developed as an offshoot from the Fischer Shortwave Area-Denial System, commonly used for less-than-lethal crowd control and breaking up riots on worlds newly integrated into the Purview. The Karpov is an up-scaled and upgunned version of the Fischer intended for combat, cooking mechs from the inside out with electromagnetic waves, and rendering devastating damage to soft targets.
effect: Attacks made with this weapon against biological targets automatically hit.

tags.name: HEAT {VAL} (SELF)
tags.description: Immediately after using this weapon or system, the user takes {VAL} Heat.

name: Detonator
description: Adapted from civilian mining triggers, the Detonator fires a beam of invisible subatomic particles calibrated to agitate potentially explosive and flammable material, allowing users to detonate set charges or vulnerable equipment from a safe distance. It also sees common use with peacekeeping forces as a mine clearing device.
effect:
This weapon detonates/activates any mines within its template
This weapon deals 10 AP damage to deployables.

name: Behold
description: Sometimes, physical information gathering is preferable to electronic scanning. A blast of subatomic particles is accelerated at the target, their small size allowing them to pass through shieldings and ricochet off of the target back at the sensor, providing accurate readings of the target's physical condition. That this blast of particles is disruptive to electronics is also a welcome bonus.
on_crit: The target must succeed on a System Save or become Impaired until the end of their next turn.

name: Sacrificial Spear
description: Study of the recovered artifact is only to be conducted in the designated air-gapped testing chamber. Personnel are forbidden from bringing electronics into the testing chamber. The testing facility, too, is to be air-gapped, with no network connection to the outside permitted. All data transfer, if necessary, will be conducted physically via the printing of the data onto paper, to be transcribed at a later date once sanitized.
effect:
Your mech gains the AI property and the Obsession Protocol. This does not count toward your AI cap.
This weapon automatically hits when targeting allied mechs.

actions.name: Obsession
actions.detail: Clear all non self-inflicted conditions. For each condition cleared, take 2 AP Energy Damage. This Protocol can be activated even while Stunned or Jammed.

name: Fusion Pike
description: A long sturdy shaft, topped with a miniature fusion torch. A simple weapon, early versions of the Fusion Pike hooked directly into a mech’s power reactor. The current version now contains a portable integrated battery while still maintaining the ability to siphon power from a mech’s reactor for extra power.
effect: While in the Danger Zone, this weapon gains Armor Piercing.

name: Zweihander
description: A Zweihander is a brutal weapon of old Cradle history, brought to the modern era with all the bells and whistles of advanced material science. A colossal blade taller than a mech’s height, sheathed in corruscating powerfields that tear at the very atoms of whatever it comes into contact with. Combined with its prodigious weight and a mech’s overclocked servos, such a weapon can cleave even the heaviest mech in twain with but a single blow, and crush all defenses under blade.

name: Cosmic Knife
description: Star-harvesting is a process by which an infinitesimally small sliver of a star’s core is drawn out for use. Contained within a field that stimulates the crushing pressure at the center of a star, a Cosmic Knife weaponizes this ever glowing hot piece of space in terrestrial warfare.

name: Fusion Lance
description: Plugging directly into a mech’s reactor, a fusion lance feeds on excess heat created by the overcharging processes to power its own weapon, turning what would otherwise be wasted energy into a beam of roiling devastation.

profiles.name: Fusion Lance
profiles.effect: When this weapon is used to attack as a part of an action granted by Overcharge, it uses the Overcharged Fusion Lance profile for the duration of the attack.

name: Reverse Guillotine
description: Much heavier than normal weapons, these blades, reminiscent of executioner swords of old, are clunky to swing and serve as more of an environmental hazard than a melee weapon. When thrown, they embed themselves into the ground firmly, presenting a slicing threat to all who treads near.
effect:
After being thrown, this weapon obstructs all movement across the space that it landed in, regardless of size, as if it was a size 1 object immune to all damage and effects.
When this weapon obstructs a hostile’s involuntary movement, the target takes 1d3+3 Armor Piercing kinetic damage. This can only trigger once per character per round.
This weapon can only be picked up by moving adjacent to it.

name: Chicxulub Heavy Shock Gauntlet
description: Crackling with barely contained energy, shimmering with heat and surrounded by arcing lightning, a Chicxulub Heavy Shock Gauntlet is the furthest thing possible from subtlety, and a testament to the Armory’s penchant for sheer power above all else. Piston driven servos, pneumatic knuckle-mounted capacitors and a dangerously unstable energy wreathe combines to make each hit of the Shock Gauntlet strike with apocalyptic force and power, the coruscating power field wrapping around the unfortunate victim and turning their hurtling chassis into a dangerous projectile of its own.
effect:
Enemies knocked back by this weapon may be knocked through spaces occupied by other characters.
Each time they pass through a character, they both take 2 AP Energy Damage.
If your target collides with an object or piece of terrain, they take 2 AP Energy Damage and deal 10 AP Energy Damage to the obstructing object or terrain. If this would destroy the object or piece of terrain, the movement continues.

name: Clarent
description:
Produced specifically for the Arthur frame, the Clarent is one of the Armory’s few dedicated melee weapons, even rarer than the Torch. Considered a worthy rival to SSC’s legendary Terashima Blade by the few who have had the pleasure of using it, the Clarent is individually optimized to each user’s specific temperament, perfectly balanced, and will never dull owing to its proprietary nano-alloyed blade. It proudly displays the fact that it is not handmade, with marketing videos emphasizing the mechanical precision and engineering prowess of its construction and design, forged in the most cutting edge facilities on Ras Shamra and built, nanometer by nanometer, to the lowest tolerance of all its competitors.
Despite its short history, arguments amongst users about the merits of the Terashima Blade and the Clarent are a common sight on the Omninet.
effect: When you Barrage, you may choose to attack with this weapon twice instead of firing two mounts. The second attack deals 1d6 kinetic damage, but gains +1 Accuracy.

effect: Gain the Counterfire reaction.
on_hit: Create a Blast 1 zone of Soft Cover centered on the target, lasting until the start of your next turn.

actions.detail: Skirmish with the ANGLER Missile against the attacking character, before the triggering attack rolls.

tags.name: SMART
tags.description: This weapon has self-guidance systems, self-propelled projectiles, or even nanorobotic ammunition. These systems are effective enough that its attacks can’t simply be dodged – they must be scrambled or jammed. Because of this, all attacks with this weapon – including melee and ranged attacks – use the target’s E-Defense instead of Evasion. Targets with no E-Defense count as having 8 E-Defense.

tags.name: SEEKING
tags.description: This weapon has a limited form of self-guidance and internal propulsion, allowing it to follow complicated paths to its targets. As long as it’s possible to draw a path to its target, this weapon ignores cover and doesn’t require line of sight.

name: Chaingun
description: Conventional air-defense Chainguns are often mounted on mechs expected to enter heavily contested air-space, drawing power from the coldcore reactor to fuel its onboard targeting supercomputer. Within a certain range, tracking is absolute, and the chaingun creates an invisible defensive dome where aircraft dare not enter.
effect: As a Quick Action, you may activate this weapon’s stabilizer: while Stabilized, you are Immobilized and this weapon gains Threat 5. You may end this effect as a Protocol.

actions.name: Activate Stabilizer
actions.detail: You activate the weapon's stabilizer, becoming immobilized and giving the weapon Threat 5.

actions.name: Deactivate Stabilizer
actions.detail: End the effects of the stabilizer, losing Immobilized (if granted by this weapon) and returning the weapon to its regular Threat value.

name: EMBER Thermobaric Nexus
description: EMBER Thermobaric Nexi are deceptive in their size. Small and unassuming, the tiny computer-guided warhead can slip beneath detection systems to detonate at important locations, utilizing a hyper catalyst to convert air-borne particulates into aerosolized fuel that are then detonated by the warhead itself.
effect: Against targets in zones of Soft Cover or zones that grant Soft Cover, this weapon deals 2 Burn instead.

name: Flak Cannon
description: Old but reliable, Flak Cannons fire canisters shots with a proximity fuze, detonating at optimal distance to blanket a wide area with millions of flechettes. Though penetration is poor, the sheer scale of the cloud of projectiles makes missing almost impossible. Though primarily used for air-defense, the flak cannon can be depressed to be used against ground targets, with particularly devastating effects against infantry and other soft targets.

name: Blade Mantle
description: Dozens of rows of hooks linked to a central coil, connected by steelsilk cables. Upon activation, the hooks lash out in a violent storm, puncturing armor and finding purchase in even the smallest nooks and crannies, wrapping around joints and severing servo tendons.
effect: This weapon ignores ranged penalties from Engaged.

If the enemy is Grappled, they receive 1 Hooked counter, which can stack up to 3 times. Enemies with at least 1 Hooked counter cannot end the grapple with a contested Hull check, and can spend one quick action to remove 1 Hooked counter.
All Hooked counters are removed if the grapple is broken by any other means.

name: Phase Tear
description: The Phase Tear is a prototypical weapon of the PROMETHEAN-Innovative line; finicky but potent when used correctly. Though commonly shaped like a blade or small spear, the Phase Tear's true form is really that of a localized tear in the spatial continuum. Only a few molecules thin, the Phase Tear containment field must be calibrated before each mission according to local conditions down to the local humidity, in order to ensure its continued functionality. Calibrated correctly, the tear can scythe through most armor with ease by not truly cutting it but merely transporting whatever it touches outside of space.
on_hit:
Create a Line 3 area of unstable energy, with the middle of the line at the targeted enemy's position and angled in any direction you choose, lasting until the end of the next round.

The area becomes difficult terrain. When characters enter one of these spaces for the first time in a round, they have their movement interrupted.

effect: This weapon can attack two targets at a time.

actions.name: Identify Structural Weakness
actions.detail: Make one attack with this weapon against the triggering enemy.
actions.trigger: An enemy within line of sight and range is critically hit, or hit with an attack that consumes Lock-on.

tags.name: ACCURATE

name: Kinetic Pick
description: Closely related to the Impact Lance as another mil-spec version of a common mining tool, the Kinetic Pick replaces its predecessor’s power field with an up-gunned version. Instead of always being on like its civilian counterpart, a Kinetic Pick’s powerfield activates a split second before impact, ensuring optimal penetration through even the thickest armor.
effect:
Against Prone, Immobilized or Stunned targets, this weapon does 1d3 bonus Energy Damage and becomes Armor Piercing.
This weapon deals 10AP Energy Damage to objects, cover, terrain, and the environment.

name: Heavy Fusion Cutter
description: The standard armament of the Yermak, the Heavy Fusion Cutter has changed very little from its civilian counterpart. Utilizing two alignment blades and three guiding lasers, the Heavy Fusion Cutter allows users to place cutting lines with mechanical precision, rotating the weapon to line up the beam wherever it is needed.

profiles.name: Dissect Mode
profiles.effect: This weapon can be fired in one of two modes.

tags.name: ACCURATE

profiles.on_attack: This weapon makes two attacks against the same target. If either attack consumes Lock-On, make a third attack against the same target.

profiles.name: Bisect Mode
profiles.effect: This weapon can be fired in one of two modes.
profiles.on_attack: Draw a Line 5 or shorter area in any direction within Range and Line of Sight, making attacks against all characters within it. The line cannot start or end beyond this Range.

name: Saturation Bombardier
description: Smart locational beacons embedded in each shell allows the Saturation Bombardier to “walk” its artillery fire from any range, using the previous shells as guidance for the next, creating a creeping barrage that moves ever onward.
effect: After an attack with this weapon, mark the centre of the Blast area that this weapon hit.
on_attack: You may instead center this weapon’s Blast on the mark, regardless of range, and add +1 to its Blast value, stacking up to Blast 3. All stacks are removed when the mark is moved by attacking a different space.

tags.name: INACCURATE
tags.description: Attacks made with this weapon receive +1 Difficulty.

tags.name: ARCING
tags.description: This weapon can be fired over obstacles, usually by lobbing a projectile in an arc. Attacks made with this weapon don’t require line of sight, as long as it’s possible to trace a path to the target; however, they are still affected by cover.

tags.name: ORDNANCE
tags.description: This weapon can only be fired before the user moves or takes any other actions on their turn, excepting Protocols. The user can still act and move normally after attacking. Additionally, because of its size, this weapon can’t be used against targets in engagement with the user’s mech, and cannot be used for Overwatch.

name: Near-light Rail
description: Though necessitating incredible power draw, reinforced construction and a suite of stabilizers and momentum dampeners, the Near-light Rail is both a useful tool and a potent weapon, utilizing rail technology to accelerate objects to near-light speed for a split second. When fully charged and with sufficient bracing, this can send even chassis careening across the battlefield, delivering them to the heart of the battle where they are needed, though this process is quite stressful on both the frame and the pilot.

profiles.effect:
You can deploy stabilizers as a Quick Action
While Stabilized, you are Immobilized. At the start of any of your turns while stabilized, this weapon gains the Charged profile.
This effect ends when you clear it as a free action, or are involuntarily moved, Grappled or Stunned.

actions.name: Retract Stabilizers
actions.detail: Retract your stabilizers, clearing Immobilized if caused by this weapon.

profiles.name: Near-light Rail (Charged)
profiles.on_attack:
An adjacent, willing ally may be pushed along the path of this weapon, ignoring engagement and reactions and passing through all characters, ending the movement in a free space overlapping the end of the Line or upon becoming obstructed by terrain or objects.
When they pass through a hostile character, they make a Ram attack against them.

name: "Flintlock" Disposable Cannon
description: The Flintlock is a fire-and-forget cannon built off a power cell rigged to explosively discharge, which is then freely discarded. Dead simple in construction and requiring almost no mounting, these are popular as a backup anti-armor weapons for infantry units, and are sometimes used by mechs as an additional disposable weapon.

tags.name: LIMITED {VAL}
tags.description: This weapon or system can only be used {VAL} times before it requires a Full Repair. Some Limited systems, like Grenades, describe these uses as “charges”. To use the system, the user expends a charge.

tags.name: HEAT {VAL} (SELF)

name: HSS-025 "Jaywalker" Shotgun
description: Cheekily named Jaywalker by marines who are issued the weapon, the HSS-025 is a simple semi-automatic shotgun using repurposed cannon barrels. Accepting buckshot and slugs, the Jaywalker is an overpowered package crammed into a small firearm, with a habit of leaping out of a user's hand if not properly braced or mounted on a chassis as an auxiliary near threat deterrence weapon.
effect: This weapon ignores ranged penalties from Engaged, and gains an additional 2 Knockback against adjacent targets.

tags.name: INACCURATE
tags.description: Attacks made with this weapon receive +1 Difficulty.

tags.name: KNOCKBACK {VAL}
tags.description: On a hit, the user may choose to knock their target {VAL} spaces in a straight line directly away from the point of origin (e.g., the attacking mech or the center of a Blast). Multiple Knockback effects stack with each other. This means that an attack made with a Knockback 1 weapon and a talent that grants Knockback 1 counts as having Knockback 2.

name: HSS-100 "Reaver" Shotgun
description: Created for those who felt the HSS-075 traded too much of the Daisy Cutter’s power for control, the HSS-100 brought back much of that capability by replacing the Flayer’s barrel and extended magazine with a larger 100mm reinforced barrel and breech-loading mechanism. While standard scatter-shells are provided as a baseline, more advanced sabot or airburst ammunition may be requested.

tags.name: LOADING
tags.description: This weapon must be reloaded after each use. Mechs can reload with Stabilize and some systems.

tags.name: INACCURATE

name: Chain Claws
on_hit: You may make a secondary attack, targeting either the same character or another within Threat. Doing so incurs this weapon’s Heat cost, but does not trigger further secondary attacks.

tags.name: OVERKILL
tags.description: When rolling for damage with this weapon, any damage dice that land on a 1 cause the attacker to take 1 Heat, and are then rerolled. Additional 1s continue to trigger this effect.

name: Chain Blades
description: Effectively an auxiliary motor attached to lengths of toothed chain, Chain Blades are ad-hoc modifications using spare saw chains wrapped around regular weapons, giving them an extra “bite” without consuming precious system space.
effect:
You cannot attack with this weapon normally. Instead, when mounted on an Aux/Aux, Flex or Main/Aux mount, give the other weapon on the mount Overkill.

Whenever the other weapon on the mount triggers Overkill, in addition to Overkill’s regular effects, make an attack with this weapon against the target if within threat. This can only trigger once per dice per attack and is the only way you can attack with this weapon.

name: Chain Glaive
description: Taking inspiration from logging tools, the Chain Glaive is a polearm pattern of IPS-N's line of chain weapons, mounted on a reinforced pole about as long as a mech is tall. Although unwieldy, the Chain Glaive's reach allows users to sweep a massive arc across the battlefield, scything down foes like weeds.

name: Thresher
description: With its roaring engine plugged straight into the heart of a mech, the Thresher necessitated an on-board flash printer to constantly manufacture new teeth, for even IPS-N's heavy duty nano-carbon blades cannot withstand the immense strain generated by this powerful weapon for long.

profiles.name: Thresher
profiles.effect: As a Quick Action, you may rev this weapon's engine. While revved, it uses the Revved profile, and you take 1 Heat at the start of your turn. You may end this effect as a Protocol.
